abstracts.cdata!:
The Road Rehabilitation Project entails
            the upgrading of 115.2km of roads in Phnom Penh
            Municipality, Sihanoukville Municipality, and Siem Reap
            Province. This Initial Environmental Assessment aims to
            identify the impacts of the project activities.
            Environmental impacts in Phnom Penh Municipality are
            negligible. In Sihanoukville Town and Siem Reap Province,
            replanting program will take place during construction to
            avoid erosion of the new fill slopes and increased siltation
            of local waterways. All culverts will have sufficient
            capacity to carry the runoff flows without constricting
            channels and increasing flow speeds so that new erosion or
            fish migration problems will not arise. During construction,
            the impact of dust will be mitigated by spraying water onto
            dry materials. Vehicles delivering materials to and from the
            construction sites should be covered. To reduce air and
            noise pollution, vehicles and machinery will be regularly
            maintained. Trees planted along the roadsides and in
            villages to replace the ones lost during construction will
            have a tending and maintenance schedule prepard and
            live-tree counts provided to the authorities concerned every
            six months.
